text: Zhang Enhua (; 28 April 1973 – 29 April 2021) was a Chinese professional football player and coach. As a player, he was a defender from 1994 to 2006. He played for Dalian Wanda FC, Grimsby Town, Tianjin Teda and South China. ==Career statistics== Appearances and goals by national team and year National team Year Apps Goals China 1995 3 0 1996 5 2 1997 21 2 1998 13 1 1999 0 0 2000 13 1 2001 4 1 2002 3 0 Total 62 7 No. Date Venue Opponent Score Result Competition 1\. 16 December 1996 Zayed Sports City Stadium, Abu Dhabi, UAE 1–0 3–4 1996 AFC Asian Cup 2\. 16 December 1996 Zayed Sports City Stadium, Abu Dhabi, UAE 3–4 3–4 1996 AFC Asian Cup 3\. 3 October 1997 Jinzhou Stadium, Dalian, China 1–0 1–0 1998 FIFA World Cup qualification 4\. 1 March 1998 International Stadium Yokohama, Yokohama, Japan 1–0 1–0 1998 Dynasty Cup 5\. 29 January 2000 Thong Nhat Stadium, Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam 2–0 2–0 2000 AFC Asian Cup qualification 6\. 3 August 2001 Shanghai Stadium, Shanghai, China 2–1 2–2 (2–4 p) 2001 Four Nations Tournament ==Honours== Dalian Wanda FC *Chinese Jia-A League: 1994, 1996, 1997, 1998, 2000, 2001, 2002 * Chinese FA Cup: 2001 * Chinese Super Cup: 1997, 2003 ==References== Category:1973 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Chinese footballers Category:Deaths from cardiac arrest Category:Grimsby Town F.C. players
title: Zhang Enhua
